newsitem.title: USA: U.S. bulk millfeeds -Prices mixed in slow activity.
newsitem.headline: U.S. bulk millfeeds -Prices mixed in slow activity.

text.p: U.S. millfeed prices were mixed amid lackluster activity, dealers said.
Dealers in various regions of the U.S. said the market had a steady tone despite the decline in CBOT soybeand and corn values.
"It is more a lack of (flour mill) runtime than any change in demand, that keeps the market pretty firm," a Buffalo dealer said.
"We are finding feed manufacturers that are really working very thin inventories," he said. "So if they miss a load by a day suddenly they have a bit of a problem with it."
People were focusing on little nagging problems like collecting invoices, a North Carolina dealer said.
In North Texas, a dealer said the lack of rain has dried out some pastures which should prompt more midd business.
"It is pretty quiet today (Monday) because the (CBOT) board is down," he said.
